task_summary: Detect the drawer handle, approach and align, grasp the handle, pull to open the drawer, confirm it is open, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator approaches a wooden cabinet with a bar-style drawer handle. The goal is to open the drawer visible in the frames by first localizing the handle, aligning the end-effector, grasping securely, then executing a pulling motion to slide the drawer open. The counter, tissue box, cup, and refrigerator are static context. The plan prioritizes precise alignment and moderate closing force, followed by a short retreat after verifying the drawer has opened.
preconditions: Robot is in front of the cabinet within reachable distance
Drawer is mechanically operable and not locked
Handle is visible to the camera
Gripper is empty and can open/close
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect the drawer handle.
Approach and align to the handle with tight tolerance.
Close gripper on the handle with moderate force.
Execute container open for a drawer (pull).
Check that the drawer is open.
Retreat a short distance to clear the workspace.
success_criteria: ContainerOpen condition returns success for the drawer
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: redo DetectObject or Scan pattern.
Misalignment: re-run ApproachAndAlign with tight tolerance.
Slipped grasp: reopen gripper and attempt CloseGripper again.
Drawer stuck: increase pull duration (within safety) or abort.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the drawer is detected as open and the robot has retreated to a safe standoff.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper is well aligned and close to the drawer handle, indicating pre-grasp completion.
frame_3.predicts_next: Initiation of grasp and pulling is imminent.

node_specs.description: Prepare gripper for grasp by opening to maximum safe width.
Move and align TCP to the handle with tight tolerance.
Close on the handle with moderate force.
Execute a pull to open the drawer.
Back off to a safe standoff after opening.

failure_modes: Handle not visible due to occlusion or lighting
Drawer friction too high leading to slip
Collision with counter edge during pull
recovery_strategy: Abort if repeated contact spikes are detected
assumptions: Frames show a wooden cabinet drawer with a bar handle accessible to the robot.
ApproachAndAlign suffices without an explicit MoveTo waypoint.
OpenContainer abstracts the pull motion required to open a drawer.

expected_success_criteria: Drawer pose change outward exceeds a small threshold
No sustained contact alarms during retreat
